meanings.definition: Things that become twisted or tangled together.
meanings.sent1: The fishing lines were full of tanglers after the storm.
meanings.sent2: She spent hours untangling the tanglers in her jewelry box.
meanings.sent3: The yarn and thread played a game of tanglers, making it hard to knit.
meanings.sent4: The vines in the jungle formed a web of tanglers, blocking the path.
meanings.sent5: The child's hair was a mass of tanglers after playing outside all day.

meanings.sent1: The wires tanglers easily if not organized properly.
meanings.sent2: The necklace tanglers when she hurriedly put it away.
meanings.sent3: The garden hose seemed to tanglers itself up every time it was used.
meanings.sent4: The branches tanglers together in a dense thicket.
meanings.sent5: The shoelaces tanglers every time he tried to tie them quickly.

meanings.definition: Causing things to become twisted or tangled.
meanings.sent1: The tanglers vines made it difficult to walk through the forest.
meanings.sent2: The wind created a tanglers mess with the laundry on the line.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten left a trail of tanglers yarn behind it.
meanings.sent4: The old phone cord was so tanglers that it was unusable.
meanings.sent5: The storm left a path of destruction, leaving behind tanglers debris everywhere.
